comment.author: 61308567@N02
comment._content: 5-11-1914 (american date order) according to the horse drawn cortege picture also on this stream.

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: After the coffins of the 17 sailor dead of Vera Cruz arrived in New York City, a National Memorial Service was held there on May 11, 1914, attended by President Wilson and the Governor of New York, as well as Mayor Mitchel of New York City. Story in the New York Times, 5/11/14: query.nytimes.com/mem/archive-free/pdf?res=940CE3DB173AE6...

comment.author: 34904489@N07
comment._content:
Wystan, 

Thanks for your efforts throughout the photographs which document the National Memorial Service of May 11, 1914. We will be able to better link the related images and expand the descriptions, including a date where one is not yet included.
